EmailTemplate.subject: Weekly Update 12th September, 2013
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents,
Thank you so much for your excellent support at our annual Meet the Teacher events this week. We have received much positive feedback including a parent attending her 6th such evening describing it as “ the best yet!”
I hope that it has given you an introduction to the staff that works so hard with pupils on a daily basis.
Class representatives 2013-14
Thank you to all parents that have volunteered to support our work in school by acting as a class representative for this academic year.
We will be contacting you next week to set up an initial meeting at the end of the month.
If any form groups are still without a representative we will contact parents directly to get one in place before that meeting.
School Uniform Update
We would like to confirm that we received an additional stock of uniforms several weeks ago and most of the items and sizes are currently available for purchase. The following items are unfortunately still not in stock:
• Boys blue summer shirts size 8
• Secondary PE T-shirts size 14
• Girls white summer shirts size 8 and 14
• Girls white winter shirts size 14
• Boys white winter shirt size 8
We are expecting another small delivery next week. Should you need any of the missing items please email Irina Targonskaya at irina.targonskaya@internationalschool.ru and she will inform you once the required item is available.
Apologies for any inconvenience caused.
Footwear in School
Please be aware that students should have the following:
A pair of Indoor shoes (black leather) and outdoor shoes.
Also training shoes should be worn on PE days.
Please understand that by following these guidelines we can ensure a clean and safe environment at school. Thank you for your support.
Residential Trips
Many of our Secondary School pupils and will embarking on expeditions next week, visiting diverse and exotic locations:
Year 7- Ardeche in Southern France
Year 8- Oman
Year 9 – Lake Baikal, Siberia
Year 10 and 11- Northern Tanzania
We know that they will enjoy a wonderful experience. Those pupils electing to stay in school will enjoy a programmme of activities designed to develop their creative and cooperative skills while working on group projects based around the arts, media and sports.
After School Activities
Our After School Activities programme begins on Tuesday and Wednesday next week. Please remember that pupils that have signed on for activities will therefore be leaving school one hour later.
I am sure that you agree we have a very diverse set of options for all this term and that they will provide an enjoyable addition to school life for our pupils.
We wish you a wonderful weekend and hope that there is a break in the succession of rainy Saturdays!
Paul Seedhouse
Headteacher The International School of Moscow World Class Education
